definition: New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
four/4
(bound form) army/military

sentences.english: In order to the Japanese island, only found near a body of the new fourth army.
sentences.chinese: 而到达岛上的日本人，只发现近一个连的新四军尸体。

sentences.english: To declare that the New Fourth Army has "mutinied" and cancel its official designation.
sentences.chinese: 宣布新四军“叛变”，取消该军番号。

sentences.english: However, it is possible to prove that any NFA is reducible to an equivalent DFA.
sentences.chinese: 不过，可以证明，任何新四军是还原相当于装配。

sentences.english: Southern anhui incident, the reconstruction of the new fourth army headquarters.
sentences.chinese: “皖南事变”后，新四军重建军部。

sentences.english: Later, he gave up his study and became a famous artist in the new 4th army corps.
sentences.chinese: 后来投笔从戎，成为新四军中的一位著名艺术家。

sentences.english: But the new fourth army drug and medical equipment as are scarce.
sentences.chinese: 但新四军的药品及医疗器械照旧奇缺。

sentences.english: Jun-jie hao to worry about the ability of the new fourth army, he is waiting for hydrostatic county of good news.
sentences.chinese: 郝俊杰担心新四军的能力，他在等静水县的好消息。

definition: Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
nationalist forces
New Fourth Army Incident of 1940, involving fighting between the Nationalists and Communists
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Tan Zhenlin (1902-1983), PRC revolutionary and military leader, played political role after the Cultural Revolution
Huaihai Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War, considered the determining battle of the war
Xiang Ying (1898-1941), communist general involved in forming the New Fourth Army 新四軍, killed in 1941 during the New Fourth Army incident 皖南事变
National Revolutionary Army
Guomindang or Kuomintang (KMT)/Nationalist Party
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
(China's) War of Resistance against Japan (1937-1945)
Su Yu (1907-1984), PLA commander
Shanxi 山西, Chahar 察哈爾|察哈尔 and Hebei 河北 (three provinces of the Republic of China in the period 1912-1936)
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
